Class AvailableTickets

  • java.lang.Object
    • AvailableTickets

  • public class AvailableTickets
extends java.lang.Object
    AvailableTickets Provides methods and attributes for interacting with the available tickets file in memory, and outputting to disk.
    Author:
    Jonathan Gillett, Daniel Smullen, Rayan Alfaheid

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String atfFile 
      private java.util.ArrayList<Ticket> tickets

      Constructor for the class.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTicket(Ticket ticket)
      Adds a Ticket object to the available tickets file collection.
      Ticket getTicket(java.lang.String event, java.lang.String username)
      The access method for the collection of available tickets.
      boolean hasTicket(java.lang.String event, java.lang.String username)
      This method is used to determine whether a Ticket object exists in the available tickets file collection.
      private void parse()
      Parses the available tickets file entries, matching the specified format based on regular expressions.
      void write()
      Outputs the available tickets file in memory to file, over-writing the old available tickets file.

      • tickets

        private java.util.ArrayList<Ticket> tickets

      • atfFile

        private java.lang.String atfFile

    • Constructor Detail

      • AvailableTickets

        public AvailableTickets(java.lang.String atfFile)
                 throws FatalError,
                        java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Constructor for the class. Takes the path to the available tickets file, and opens it.
        Parameters:
        atfFile - The path to the available tickets file. Unix-style paths only.
        Throws:
        FatalError - Fatal errors occur under the following circumstances:
        The Available Tickets File is missing, or not found at the path specified.
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException

    • Method Detail

      • addTicket

        public void addTicket(Ticket ticket)
        Adds a Ticket object to the available tickets file collection.
        Parameters:
        ticket - The Ticket object to add to the collection.

      • getTicket

        public Ticket getTicket(java.lang.String event,
               java.lang.String username)
        The access method for the collection of available tickets. Requires an event title and a username for the seller to return the correct Ticket.
        Parameters:
        event - String containing the event title for the desired Ticket.
        username - String containing the seller's username for the desired Ticket.
        Returns:
        Returns the Ticket object for the specified event. If the ticket was not found, the method returns null.

      • hasTicket

        public boolean hasTicket(java.lang.String event,
                java.lang.String username)
        This method is used to determine whether a Ticket object exists in the available tickets file collection. Requires that the event title and the seller's username is specified to match the Ticket against.
        Parameters:
        event - String containing the event title for the specified Ticket.
        username - String containing the seller's username for the specified Ticket.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the ticket was found in the collection. Otherwise, returns false.

      • write

        public void write()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Outputs the available tickets file in memory to file, over-writing the old available tickets file.
        Throws:
        FatalError - Fatal errors occur under the following circumstances:
        The Available Tickets File is corrupted.
        java.io.IOException

      • parse

        private void parse()
            throws FatalError,
                   java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Parses the available tickets file entries, matching the specified format based on regular expressions.
        Throws:
        FatalError - Fatal errors occur under the following circumstances:
        The Current User Accounts File is missing, or not found at the path specified.
        The current user accounts file is corrupted.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        java.io.IOException
